summary: Alfred S Hack was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his position and salary during that period. The documents indicate his continued employment with the HSCA throughout its investigation.
significance: Alfred S Hack's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination of JFK. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates his involvement in the committee's operations.
